intro: Eupatorium oxylepis, commonly known as the purple false dragonhead, is a herbaceous perennial native to tropical and subtropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring narrow, lance-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to purple. Eupatorium oxylepis is often found in moist, shaded environments such as forests and wetlands. Its ornamental value and potential medicinal properties make it a subject of interest in horticulture and botanical research.
